summary: Led Zeppelin IV, released in 1971, is the untitled fourth album by the English rock band Led Zeppelin. It was produced by guitarist Jimmy Page and recorded at Headley Grange. The album features their most famous song, "Stairway to Heaven." After poor reviews for their previous album, the band decided to release this one without a title, using four symbols instead. It includes guest musicians and one cover song. Led Zeppelin IV is the band's best-selling album, with over 37 million copies sold worldwide, and is considered one of the greatest albums of all time.
title: Led Zeppelin IV
